derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'touch'): from Old French tast (noun), taster (verb) 'touch, try, taste', perhaps based on a blend of Latin tangere 'to touch' and gustare 'to taste'

entry.def: Taste is one of the five senses that people have. When you have food or drink in your mouth, your sense of taste makes it possible for you to recognize what it is.

The taste of something is the individual quality which it has when you put it in your mouth and which distinguishes it from other things. For example, something may have a sweet, bitter, sour, or salty taste.

example.ex: I like the taste of wine and enjoy trying different kinds...
example.tran: 我喜欢葡萄酒的味道，喜欢品尝不同的口味。

example.ex: The taste of blood in her throat made her want to vomit...
example.tran: 她嗓子里的血腥味让她直恶心。

entry.def: If you have a taste of some food or drink, you try a small amount of it in order to see what the flavour is like.

example.ex: We have a taste of the white wine he's brought.
example.tran: 我们尝了尝他带来的白葡萄酒。

entry.def: If food or drink tastes of something, it has that particular flavour, which you notice when you eat or drink it.

example.ex: I drank a cup of tea that tasted of diesel...
example.tran: 我喝了杯有股柴油味的茶。

entry.def: If you taste some food or drink, you eat or drink a small amount of it in order to try its flavour, for example to see if you like it or not.

example.ex: He finished his aperitif and tasted the wine the waiter had produced...
example.tran: 他喝完开胃酒，又尝了点侍者端来的葡萄酒。

example.ex: Before proceeding any further, cut off a small bit of the meat and taste it.
example.tran: 在进行下一步之前，先切一小块肉尝尝。

entry.def: If you can taste something that you are eating or drinking, you are aware of its flavour.

example.ex: You can taste the chilli in the dish but it is a little sweet.
example.tran: 你可以尝出菜里面有辣椒，不过味道有点甜。

entry.def: If you have a taste of a particular way of life or activity, you have a brief experience of it.

example.ex: But having had a taste of the big time, he won't want to go back to playing in the reserves...
example.tran: 但是，有过一举成名的经历以后，他就不会再想回去当替补了。

example.ex: This voyage was his first taste of freedom.
example.tran: 这次航行使他初次体验到了自由的滋味。

entry.def: If you taste something such as a way of life or a pleasure, you experience it for a short period of time.

example.ex: Anyone who has tasted this life wants it to carry on for as long as possible.
example.tran: 任何过过这种日子的人都希望它持续得越久越好。

entry.def: If you have a taste for something, you have a liking or preference for it.

example.ex: She developed a taste for journeys to isolated hazardous regions in North America...
example.tran: 她喜欢上了到北美那些险象环生的偏远地区旅行。

example.ex: That gave me a taste for reading.

entry.def: A person's taste is their choice in the things that they like or buy, for example their clothes, possessions, or music. If you say that someone has good taste, you mean that you approve of their choices. If you say that they have poor taste, you disapprove of their choices.

example.ex: His taste in clothes is extremely good...
example.tran: 他在穿衣方面很有品味。

example.ex: Oxford's social circle was far too liberal for her taste.
example.tran: 牛津的社交圈过于开放，不合她的胃口。

entry.tran: 格调庸俗的/格调高雅的;没品位的/高品位的;不合时宜的/得体的
entry.def: If you say that something that is said or done is in bad taste or in poor taste, you mean that it is offensive, often because it concerns death or sex and is inappropriate for the situation. If you say that something is in good taste, you mean that it is not offensive and that it is appropriate for the situation.

example.ex: He rejects the idea that his film is in bad taste...
example.tran: 他不接受那种认为他的电影格调不高的观点。

example.ex: I do not feel your actions were either appropriate or done in good taste.
example.tran: 我认为你的行为既不妥当又不合时宜。

entry.def: When a recipe tells you to add a particular spice or other flavouring to taste, it means that you can add as much of that ingredient as you like.

example.ex: Add tomato paste, salt and pepper to taste.
example.tran: 酌量添加番茄酱、盐和胡椒粉。

means.word_mean: 1. the sensation that results when taste buds in the tongue and throat convey information about the chemical composition of a soluble stimulus;

sentences.sentence: "the candy left him with a bad taste"
"my own preference is for good literature"
"the Irish have a penchant for blarney"
"arrogance and lack of taste contributed to his rapid success"
"to ask at that particular time was the ultimate in bad taste"
"he got a taste of life on the wild side"
"she enjoyed her brief taste of independence"

means.word_mean: 5. a small amount eaten or drunk;

sentences.sentence: "his cold deprived him of his sense of taste"

means.word_mean: 7. a kind of sensing; distinguishing substances by means of the taste buds;
3. perceive by the sense of taste;
4. have a distinctive or characteristic taste;

sentences.sentence: "The ex-slave tasted freedom shortly before she died"

sentences.en: The food has an attractive taste.
She has excellent taste in dress.
sentences.cn: 她对衣着有极好的鉴赏力。

sentences.en: Their tastes are different from mine.
sentences.cn: 他们的爱好与我的不同。

sentences.en: Sometimes when you are ill, you can't taste properly.
sentences.cn: 有时生病时吃什么都没有滋味。

sentences.en: I have not tasted food for two days.
They tasted defeat for the first time.
sentences.cn: 他们第一次体验到失败的滋味。

sentences.en: I can't taste when I have a cold.

jushi.chinese: 我患了感冒,所以丧失了味觉。

jushi.english: These styles can be adapted to suit individual tastes.
jushi.chinese: 这些式样可以加以更改,以适合个人的喜好。

jushi.english: This milk has got a funny taste.
